newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: UOB top bidder for govt land tender.
newsitem.headline: UOB top bidder for govt land tender.

text.p: A consortium led by the United Overseas Bank group sent in the top bid of Singapore $508 million for a site in a government land tender on Wednesday, said a statement from the Urban Redevelopment Authority.
The other members of the consortium were United Overseas Land, the property arm of the bank, and also Singapore Land Ltd.
The price worked out to be S$7,256.13 per sq metre for the 16,669 sq m site in Novena Junction in the central part of Singapore. The site is zoned for commercial development.
The bid was about 10 percent above market expectations, said Ng Yeow Tong, property analyst with GK Goh Securities.
"It looks like the UOB group or its chairman Wee Chow Yaw is bullish over the medium term prospects for the commercial market," he said.
The UOB tender was about 30 percent higher than the next bid sent in by the Hong Leong and City Developments Ltd consortium.
Another 6,525.08 sq m site at Rochor Road saw the highest bid at S$236.81 million from Hwang Chou-Shiuan.
